För alla er som inte får det att fungera. Det finns ett sätt att spela gratis. Följ bara instruktionerna nedan:

Thats right you guys can play WoW for free!!!! Here's how!!
============================================================
Original from:http://rv2.org/blog/2005/03/03/world-of-warcraft-online-play
Edited by: Craze3 (plainflash.com)
****************FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY!!!*****************
=============================================================
World of Warcraft is a great game except the $14.99 monthly fee is a bit steep. However, you can play on a emulated 
WoW private server for free.

1) Install World of Warcraft. How you obtain World of Warcraft is up to you. You can either buy or download it at 
ISO Hunt. Downloading it at ISO Hunt may be illegal.

2) Sign up for an account on the server you want. 

3) Edit your realmlist.wtf file. If you went with the default installation, it should be located at 
“C:Program FilesWorld of Warcraftrealmlist.wtf”. Open it in Notepad and change the current text to 
“set realmlist dkr.no-ip.org”.

4) Download this update (http://downloads-3dg.planetmirror.com/pub/3dgamers/games/worldofwarcraft/wow-1.2.3-enus-patch.exe) 
if your World of Warcraft version number is lower than 1.2.3. All private servers run either on 1.2.3 or 1.2.4. If you are 
running 1.2.3 it will automatically download an update to 1.2.4. If you are running lower than 1.2.3 it will not download 
update automatically, so you will have to download this manual update.

5) Download WDBRemover (http://www.rv2.org/files/WDB(sp).exe ) and run it before playing World of Warcraft. It will help 
reduce the amount of errors that appear when playing World of Warcraft.

6) Open up World of Warcraft. To login in simply use the username and password you registered for earlier at http://dkr.no-ip.org:8080/. 
That should be it! :grin: Just make sure you are running WDBRemover while playing World of Warcraft.

If you are still running into error problems try running Blizzard’s repair tool(http://home.comcast.net/~thesmallelder/Repair.exe)

Open servers: 
LusoWoW
Register: http://lusowow.servegame.com:8081/
Edit realmlist.wtf to “set realmlist lusowow.servegame.com”
-----------------------------------------------------------
Craze's Extra Notes for Help:
---------------------------------------------------------

There are more servers. The link to iso hunt is isohunt.com. I've used isohunt before...but they arent too fast...

Complete list of servers: http://www.blizzhackers.com/viewforum.php?f=163&sid=58f7b0b12b6827f7b0d1ecdd1498d0a3

(edited)

Now you need to update the game. Use the update link mentioned in step 4, or use the link below:
ftp://ftp.uunet.co.za/pub/incoming/WoW/wow-1.2.3-1.2.4.rar

===========================================================

there u go!

-craze3
